Sentencas: The adsorption of H2S, HS, S, H and the dissociation of H2S on the Ni2Ge/Ni (1 1 1) are systematically studied using the first-principles method based on density functional theory.
Titulo: Enhanced sulfur resistance of Ni(111) surface alloyed with Ge: A first principles study

Sentencas: It is found that the Ge doping in the surface layer is more stable than that in the second layer, which indicates that Ge prefers the surface alloying with Ni.
Titulo: Enhanced sulfur resistance of Ni(111) surface alloyed with Ge: A first principles study

Sentencas: Near the Fermi level, the density of states (DOS) of Ni 3d in the Ni2Ge/Ni(1 1 1) surface decreased a lot as compared with that in the Ni(111) surface.
Titulo: Enhanced sulfur resistance of Ni(111) surface alloyed with Ge: A first principles study

Sentencas: The hybridization of S 3p and Ni 3d on Ni2Ge/Ni(1 1 1) is decreased as compared with that on Ni(111) which results in the weakening adsorption of S on the Ni2Ge/Ni(1 1 1).
Titulo: Enhanced sulfur resistance of Ni(111) surface alloyed with Ge: A first principles study

Sentencas: The H2S dissociation is inhibited by alloying with Ge atoms in the Ni(111) surface.
Titulo: Enhanced sulfur resistance of Ni(111) surface alloyed with Ge: A first principles study

Sentencas: Furthermore, the adsorption energies of sulfur containing species are decreased a lot.
Titulo: Enhanced sulfur resistance of Ni(111) surface alloyed with Ge: A first principles study

Sentencas: The results show that alloying with Ge may be a good way to enhance the sulfur resistance of Ni based anode catalysts of solid oxide fuel cells.
Titulo: Enhanced sulfur resistance of Ni(111) surface alloyed with Ge: A first principles study
